greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors of n minus the number of distinct values that A297167 obtains over the divisors > 1 of n: a(n) = A000005(n) - A324190(n).
comment: a(p^k) = 1 for all primes p and all exponents k >= 0, because with prime powers there are k divisors larger than 1 and A297167 obtains a distinct value for each one of them.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 19 2019
